snippet: Navi Pillay, the high commissioner for human rights, said she feared that international outrage had been numbed by two years of conflict.
abstract: Navi Pillay, United Nations commissioner for human rights, urges haste in ending crisis in Syria, expressing fear that international outrage has been numbed by two years of conflict; says she believes that war crimes and crimes against humanity have been committed there.

byline.contributor: David M. Herszenhorn contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Navi Pillay, the high commissioner for human rights, said she feared that international outrage had been numbed by two years of conflict.

headline.seo: U.N. Rights Chief Urges Faster Action to End Fighting in Syria
headline.main: U.N. Rights Chief Urges Faster Action to End Fighting in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Urges Haste In Ending Syria Crisis
